New Student Enrollment for 2020-2021 School Year

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, WISD will have a "contactless" enrollment which will be completed all online. Online enrollment is open beginning Wednesday, June 3rd. We have made a few changes to our enrollment process to enable parents to upload all required enrollment documents and complete necessary forms.

To start the enrollment process, you will go to http://www.wyliebulldogs.org/enrollment/ to begin the enrollment process.

Please make sure you read through all of the required documents to avoid delaying your child's enrollment process.

Parents will receive a confirmation email once their registration is processed. Your Family Access login will be given to you once you are processed, but keep in mind you will not be able to login to Family Access until the beginning of August.

Back-to-School information along with Meet the Teacher dates and times will be posted on our main webpage this summer at www.wyliebulldogs.org. If you need assistance, you may send an email to onlineenroll@wyliebulldogs.org.

Calling all Bulldogs to do our part by completing the 2020 Census! All you have to do is click on the link at the end of this post to get started.

The 2020 Census count impacts the federal funds that communities receive each year for programs and services that are critical for schools, students, and younger children, including:

- Special education, early childhood education, after-school programs, and classroom technology.
- Food assistance, including free and reduced-price school lunches.
- Maternal and child health programs.

The results of the 2020 Census will help determine how hundreds of billions of dollars in federal funding flow into communities every year for the next decade. That funding shapes many different aspects of every community, no matter the size, no matter the location.

The #2020Census invitation has been mailed to homes across the U.S. You can respond online, by phone, or by mail.

Respond now at https://2020census.gov/

Free Wifi Hot Spot!!

WesTex Connect has provided our community with a FREE Wifi hot spot for those who need a place to connect their devices to the internet during this time of online learning. The hot spot is located at the Wylie High School Bulldog Stadium parking lot that is in front of the press box.

Users can access the internet through any digital device with wifi capabilities, such as a smartphone, tablet or laptop.

1. On your device, search for available networks and connect to WesTex Connect-Guest.

2. The first time that you connect it takes you to a page to accept the terms and conditions. Click FREE and then click I AGREE.

3. You should then be automatically connected to the Wifi

4. Internet access will be filtered and parking lot hours will be from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm. The gates to the parking lot will be closed outside of these hours.

Thank you so much to WesTex Connect for this service that has been provided to our community!

It is hard to put into words what Hugh and Brenda Sandifer mean to Wylie ISD and the impact that they have had on our community. This is a beautifully written article that puts some of those sentiments that we feel into words. Thank you to the Sandifers for the people that you are and the legacy that you are leaving. We wish you the very best as you begin your next chapter in retirement!

"Sandifer, who announced Friday that he'll be ending his 41-year tenure at Wylie when he retires at the end of this school year, is and will be remembered as a great coach. But it's not his 285 career wins (the 17th highest total in Texas high school football history), four state championship game appearances or 2004 title run with current Redskins quarterback Case Keenum that will define his legendary career. It is, instead, the integrity with which he operated and the way he treated and impacted people from his role as a mentor..."

post_text: The Wylie Pure Gold Band works SO HARD and we are SO proud of them!
shared_text:
Wylie Pure Gold Band
October 14, 2019 at 5:03 PM ·

Incredibly proud of these AMAZING band students and their superior performance this past weekend at the Big Country Marching Festival! If you missed it, don’t worry! We go again for UIL Region Marching on Monday, October 21st at Bulldog Stadium!

One of the most beautiful things about marching band is that you compete against yourself while finding community and connection with your competitors. It’s all about how we move each other’s hearts. Collaboration and community is key. It’s important enough where people voluntarily choose to work together to organize and host these events!

- 24 performing ensembles
- Over 1,400 Chick-Fil-A sandwiches
- 8 hours of judge commentary
- 15 props

The Wylie Hall of Honor Committee is accepting nominations through August 1st!

The Wylie Hall of Honor recognizes alumni, faculty, staff, and community members who have demonstrated notable accomplishments or provided significant contributions to their school, community or society.

In order for alumni to be nominated, a minimum of 10 years must have passed since their attendance. Faculty members are not eligible while employed by the district. There are no restrictions for the nomination of community members. Honorees will be recognized at an induction ceremony in conjunction with Homecoming ceremonies.

Anyone may submit names and the committee will select the honoree. Nominees can be submitted to the Wylie school district by e-mail at hallofhonor@wylie.esc14.net.

Alzheimer's Association - Abilene, TX is with Renee Riggs McClellan and Brenda Enjady James.
June 17, 2019 at 11:53 PM ·

Congratulations to the Wylie High School (Abilene, Texas) Destination Imagination team *forced laughter* for placing 1st place in Instant Challenge and 5th place in the world in their technical challenge at the Global Finals tournament in Kansas City, Missouri, May 22-25, 2019. They competed against 50 other teams from 26 different states and countries such as Australia, Poland, China, South Korea, and Turkey.

Their challenge required them to write a story about a character who explored an unknown location while integrating the story with the launching of an aircraft that dropped payloads into a 12”x12” square on the floor. The team wrote a story of a man who had Alzheimer’s disease and explored his brain by searching for memories of his wife’s name. They integrated the memories in a series of flashbacks that played out during the skit.

We are encouraged to see such young people helping spread awareness and proud to have been asked to provide insight on the disease for them as they prepared for their DI season!
